title: Was the Bible Reliably Copied? | Truth with Tact - Episode 9
description:
Hey everyone, hope y'all are excited for another episode of my apologetics series "Truth with Tact"! 

In this video, I will cover a topic that is often brought up when discussing the Bible, this being whether the Bible was reliably copied by scribes over the years. Many in recent years have compared the copying or transmission of the Bible to things like the telephone game, which gives the impression that our modern Bible may not reflect what the authors originally wrote. Many suggest that, whether intentionally or not, significant changes were made to the Bible over the years, such that core doctrines may have been changed. These changes may be so significant that the Christianity practiced today would be entirely alien to what the apostles originally taught. This has often lead to wild speculation about what the Bible REALLY used to say, with some suggesting that the Bible used to teach concepts like reincarnation, spiritual enlightenment, that Jesus had a wife, and that Jesus may have even been opposed to the Old Testament God. This begs the question, how has the Bible been changed over the years, and are the changes that have been made to the Bible significant enough to impact key Christian doctrines? This is what I hope to answer in this video. This episode will therefore discuss copyist errors in Biblical manuscripts, the topic of textual criticism, and we will determine whether what our Bibles say today reflects what the authors originally wrote. 

With all that being said, I hope you enjoy this latest episode of Truth with Tact!

Below are some timestamps to navigate the various topics covered in this video:
0:00 Reviewing Truth With Tact so far
1:50 How did we actually get the Bible?
7:52 Could the Bible have been intentionally changed?
12:10 What about unintentional changes?
14:00 Why are there 400,000 variants in the Bible?
20:56 Why the age of a manuscript matters
28:02 How impactful are these 400,000 variants?
32:02 What are meaningful and viable variants?
34:58 Do meaningful, viable variants impact Christianity?
38:14 Is uncertainty an issue for reliability?
41:17 Isn't the Bible just a translation of a translation of a translation of a...
44:18 A brief note on the Quran and KJV Only groups

title: Advice for Sharing your Faith (The Columbo Tactic) | Truth with Tact - Episode 8
description:
Hey everyone, welcome to the 8th video in our apologetics series "Truth with Tact"!

For most Christians, we frankly may find it hard to talk about our faith. Many people, I find, have been taught almost all their lives that the two things you should never bring up in conversation are religion and politics. If that's not already discouraging enough, many Christians may not feel equipped to talk about their faith. They may not have all the answers, they may be uncomfortable with more confrontational conversations, or they may not know how to best introduce or approach a conversation about faith. 

If any of these things sound like something that applies to you, don't worry, because in this video we will cover various tactics and things to consider which will help you better share your faith and navigate tricky conversations about religion, morality, apologetics and more. 

If you want to learn how to share your faith in a way that's less intrusive, more fruitful, and in a way that can work even if you don't have all the answers, then this is the video for you. With all that being said, sit back, relax, and enjoy the video.


Timestamps are below to better navigate the video's contents:

0:00 Intro and Reading Material
0:43 Apologetics isn't just about knowledge
3:44 Hard questions & assertions
6:46 The value of situational awareness
14:19 Different people warrant different responses
19:34 Don't get rage-baited
19:52 Things to consider when dealing with challenges
29:16 Who is detective Columbo?
31:27 Introducing the Columbo tactic
33:01 What the Columbo tactic accomplishes
35:07 Another helpful tip
36:00 Advantages of the Columbo tactic 
40:15 Outro/practicing Columbo

title: Historical Evidence for the Resurrection | Truth with Tact - Episode 7 (Easter Special)
description:
Happy Easter everyone! He is Risen! Hallelujah!

In this video, since Christians around the world are celebrating the resurrection today, I will present just some of the historical evidence for the resurrection of Jesus. Jesus' resurrection is absolutely central to Christianity. Christianity stands or falls on the reality of the resurrection of Jesus. If Jesus is still dead, so too is Christianity. This of course begs the obvious question, do we have good historical evidence to say that Jesus rose from the dead? Well, watch this video and find out. I think for many, you may be surprised to hear what evidence there is for Jesus Christ's resurrection. 

Below are some timestamps to navigate the various topics covered in this video:
0:00 Intro
0:56 What makes Christianity unique
1:56 My approach
4:47 The evidence for the crucifixion and empty tomb
10:10 How we know Jesus' followers thought he had risen
13:35 How we know former skeptics saw Jesus
15:03 How we know the gospel was first preached in Jerusalem
15:40 How we know the resurrection defied expectations
17:54 How we know the disciples were persecuted
20:20 But what if Jesus never died?
23:06 What if the resurrection was just made up?
30:16 Could it have been a mass hallucination?
33:14 What about the Islamic explanation? 
36:00 What about Gerd LÃ¼demann's explanation?
37:02 The most historically viable theory
38:50 Why the resurrection is historically likely 
42:31 Christianity is true even without the Bible?

title: MORE Arguments for God's Existence | Truth with Tact - Episode 6
description:
Hey everyone, in this video Steve (the cohost of this apologetics program) will discuss various arguments for the existence of God, covering about six to seven different arguments. Now as you can imagine, one cannot cover this many arguments for the existence of God in much detail within a 23 minute timeframe. This video is therefore aimed at simply introducing you to these arguments for the existence of God, and whenever possible I've provided some other videos in the description for you to further dig into these topics. With that being said, I hope you enjoy this latest episode of my apologetics series "Truth with Tact" and I look forward to seeing you in the next episode where we'll discuss the historical evidence for the resurrection of Jesus. 

Like with all my other videos, below are several timestamps to help you navigate the video's contents:

2:28 What can science not explain?

title: The Moral Argument: Can We Be Good Without God? | Truth with Tact - Episode 5
description:
In this video I go over what was once my least favorite argument for the existence of God: The Moral Argument for God's Existence. While this was once my least favorite argument for the existence of God, I have come to appreciate it more and more as I've really mulled it over. The moral argument argues for the existence of God on the basis of objective moral values, facts, and duties that we ought to follow. If that sounds interesting to you, then sit back, relax, and enjoy this latest video in my apologetics series "Truth with Tact".

(Also, if the thumbnail of the video looks different at times it's because I'm trying YouTube's new feature where they determine the best thumbnail out of 3 possible thumbnails. I couldn't decide which one looked best so I'll let that play out and see). 

Like with all my other videos, below are several timestamps to help you navigate the video:
0:00 Intro
0:58 On objective morality
2:59 Aren't societies the source of morality?
5:44 Where Atheists and Christians agree (historically)
8:07 Are some things JUST good or evil?
11:14 Can biology explain morality?
16:09 Why God is the best explanation for morality
17:31 How the moral argument fits with other arguments
18:31 Addressing misconceptions
21:09 Baby's first argument for God's existence
21:48 Additional resources

title: The Fine-Tuning Argument/Teleological Argument for God's Existence | Truth with Tact - Episode 4
description:
In this video I will cover one of my favorite arguments for the existence of God, this being the Fine-Tuning Argument, a type of teleological argument.
The reason why this argument is my favorite is because even amongst atheists, it is often widely acknowledged as one of the best arguments for the existence of God. 
Teleological arguments point to the fact that certain things in nature look carefully designed for a particular purpose to argue for the existence of a designer behind them, said designer of course being God. In the case of the fine-tuning argument, it notes that the physical constants and quantities of the universe are fine-tuned for life in a way that is astronomically unlikely to be the case unless some entity fine-tuned them in order to have a universe capable of supporting life. 
If any of this sounds interesting to you, then sit back, relax and enjoy this fourth episode in my apologetics series "Truth with Tact".


Like with my other videos, below are some timestamps to help you navigate the video:
0:00 Why did God make the universe?
1:27 What are physical constants?
4:56 Why the universe is fine-tuned for life
8:04 What are the chances of us being here?
12:57 How can we explain fine-tuning? 
16:00 What about the multiverse?
20:31 What is the best explanation for fine-tuning?


To see the last video in this series, which covers the cosmological argument, see the link below:
https://youtu.be/aBfoiIqk4I4?si=wLHsUz6ILDCB8eN0

For more videos on the fine-tuning argument (including one I've made previously), see the links below:
https://youtu.be/EE76nwimuT0?si=A0Qh3xeh49GCMWn-
https://youtu.be/BId8kdBFHKM?si=-eWk_XGo7F3LZVBy
https://youtu.be/PqjBOSlk_mE?si=0Fk43FtYvF3vT7hA
https://youtube.com/shorts/DRz0Q_n4I1E?si=xFvZsI2ovJBUXy6S
https://youtu.be/3Yt7hvgFuNg?si=IoGTy5JXKVk-otfm
https://youtu.be/ZO-QyzsDmps?si=rqr_ZPeplD67Sq9w
https://youtu.be/bGbbWyd4l7Q?si=9qpUY_zUuQslZcNN
https://youtu.be/7iVuMRwi5Wg?si=Twi1SnR9r38wufuv
https://youtu.be/ntdTWREYFJk?si=2yFfb5nDOAwf6zUs
https://youtu.be/0hn-7ckOt-8
https://www.youtube.com/live/lgTnUBti5ZU?si=VfZmtoLXr4FTZtKa
https://www.youtube.com/live/58brbYwN0Q0?si=Tf_tB0xIudS9AvfY

Also below is a link to the channel "BeauMaths" who's some nerd who does math videos:
https://youtube.com/@beaumaths?si=WG_00pXyv1lZVBtM


Also, as I mentioned in this video, there were other physical constants and quantities that were very unlikely to be fine-tuned to allow for the existence of life that I couldn't mention in the video. Here are just a few of them: 
-The ratio of protons to electrons had only a 1 in 10^37 chance of being fine-tuned for life
-The expansion rate of the universe had only a 1 in 10^37 chance of being fine-tuned for life
-The strong nuclear force constant had only a 1 in 10^37 chance of being fine-tuned for life.
-The ratio of the electromagnetic force to gravitational force constant had only a 1 in 10^40 chance of being fine-tuned for life
-The mass density of the universe had only a 1 in 10^59 chance of being fine-tuned for life 
-Lastly, the amount of dark energy in the universe had only a 1 in 10^122 chance of being fine-tuned for life

There are other physical constants/quantities that were also unlikely to be fine-tuned for life such as: the electromagnetic force constant, the excess of nucleons to anti-nucleons, and the decay rates of elements. However, I couldn't find exact values that show HOW fine-tuned they are for life. 

I should also note, at some point in the video I stated that even if you have 10^500 universes, there is still only a 1 in 10 billion chance that one of them would be fine-tuned for life. This is only true if one excludes the fine-tuning for the distribution of mass and energy at the start of the early universe, the fine-tuning of the amount of dark energy in the universe, the fine-tuning of the critical density of the universe, and the fine-tuning of several other constants and quantities. In short, saying that "there's only a 1 in 10 billion chance of having a universe with life in it if we have 10^500 universes to work with" is actually SIGNIFICANTLY low-balling how unlikely it actually is to have a universe with life in it given those conditions. In reality, even if 10^500 other universes existed, it would be almost impossible for one of those universes to be capable of supporting life. 


With all of that being said, I hope you enjoy this video, I hope it gives you something to think about, and I hope to see you in the next video in this series, where I will be discussing the moral argument for the existence for God. Thank you for watching, God bless!



#christian #apologetics #finetuning

title: The Cosmological Argument/Contingency Argument for God's Existence | Truth with Tact - Episode 3
description:
In this video, we give a brief overview of one of the most common and well known arguments for the existence of God. This also happens to be one of the oldest recorded arguments for the existence of God, being recorded as early as 500 BCE (Before Christ's Era). This argument is of course the Cosmological Argument (specifically the Kalam Cosmological Argument), which is a type of contingency argument. This argument uses the fact that the universe had its origin some time in the distant past to point to the existence of God. If this sounds interesting to you and if you are curious about the evidence for the existence of God, then this may just be the video for you!

Below are some timestamps to navigate through the video
0:00 Intro
1:37 Prayer
2:16 Where do things come from?
5:47 Where did the universe come from?
6:58 The Enlightenment/Age of Reason
9:22 Evolution
12:00 Views on the origin of the universe
14:10 How we know the universe began
18:10 The uncaused first cause
19:06 Why is God the best explanation for our universe?
19:42 Limits of cosmological arguments
20:16 More resources 
21:47 Cryptid sighting? 

As mentioned in the video, below are several other videos which also discuss the cosmological argument. These provide significantly more detail in areas where more could've been said. For instance, some of these videos provide several lines of scientific and philosophical evidence which helps to verify that the universe began to exist some time in the distant past. If you find that William Lane Craig is slightly overrepresented in these videos, it's probably because he is more or less the modern champion of this argument. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VeKavDdRVIg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s2ULF5WixMM
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kKKIvmcO5LQ
https://youtu.be/6CulBuMCLg0?si=2E0DzLJZCxvYUiEh
https://youtu.be/vybNvc6mxMo?si=I3CuplKyCfMC2-Ha
https://youtu.be/UQwLbDN7amo?si=uvvDw9kU3VuLzjnB
https://youtu.be/FPCzEP0oD7I?si=BSRmFcG3ffhnWeeY
https://www.youtube.com/live/eYBdleq-9Kc?si=4sLOB_2fuUx652qX

If you want to see my old video on the cosmological argument (which also discusses the teleological argument/fine-tuning argument, and some teleological arguments based on biology), the link to that is below:
https://youtu.be/0hn-7ckOt-8

If you want to see some videos that deal with the major objections to the cosmological argument, some of those are listed below: 
https://www.youtube.com/live/DrgSbFhHCmU?si=wxayldFMxwrpRT_0
https://youtu.be/xS6xHagcOd0?si=SQTvX2Q7AgBrp3ji
https://youtu.be/3rX9yTwgHvQ?si=eVukFvkq7nhnkPrS

Lastly, these videos are somewhat weird, since they tackle the issue of quantum mechanics, but they still fit with the main conclusions of the cosmological argument:
https://youtu.be/_ie9musGEqQ?si=QaRLZqxB-HvuP4a2
https://youtu.be/iFEBOGLjuq4?si=beXtGc5fWcSO70qN

With all that being said, I hope you enjoy this video, I hope it gives you something to think about, I wish you all a great day, and stay tuned for the next episode in this series where I'll cover the Fine-Tuning/Teleological Argument for the existence of God. I'd highly recommend it, as it pairs very well with this argument, like how a fine wine pairs very well with... whatever fine wines pair with. 

#christian #apologetics #kalam

title: How Skeptics Misunderstand God: The Nature of Evidence | Truth with Tact - Episode 2
description:
In this video I focus on the nature of evidence. So we will discuss what counts as evidence, how we can use evidence to come to conclusions, how the scientific method works, and how we come to conclusions in history, science, mathematics, and in law. 
Additionally, this video will heavily focus on common misconceptions/misunderstandings that skeptics of Christianity have regarding the evidence for the existence of God, the evidence for the truth of Christianity, the nature of God, and the very nature of faith itself. This will include a lengthy discussion of what God is, how we can make sense of miracles, and much, much more. 

If all this sounds interesting to you, then I'm sure you'll enjoy this second episode in my apologetics series: "Truth with Tact".

Below are some timestamps to help you navigate the video:

0:00 Background info
3:04 What is evidence?
8:56 The issue with "proving" things
11:33 How do we come to conclusions?
12:05 Understanding the scientific method
15:13 Science's 2 most important aspects
16:41 Can science disprove God?
21:32 Why miracles are reasonable
27:37 How should we evaluate miracle claims?
28:12 How do we know what's true in court?
30:20 The historical method
36:52 Our methodology for future videos
37:38 Is the Bible just fiction?
39:17 Is faith belief without evidence?
41:19 Summary 

If you wanted to learn more about the siege of Tyre mentioned in this video, you can see a video I did on the subject linked below: 
https://youtu.be/5u_LA7k4rpk?si=KLKWMOvjsoyGLbYM

If you were curious about that infamous debate between Wesley Huff and Billy Carson mentioned in this video, the link to that video is shown below:
https://youtu.be/F7ngjtT43-4?si=G_-Col6qmGJupJcs

Lastly, if you want to see the last episode in this series, the link to that is below as well:
https://youtu.be/7ZTJOS2qO9c?si=hbCPVGExrZ7RrdH3

I hope you enjoy this video. If you did, please feel free to leave a like, a comment, subscribe to the channel, and hit that bell so you don't miss the next episode in this series, as the next episode will be coming up shortly. 

Thank you all for watching, and I wish you all a happy New Year!








#apologetics #christian #christianity #evidence

title: What is Apologetics? | Truth with Tact - Episode 1
description:
Hey everyone, this video is the first in a series I did with my local church on apologetics. In this series we cover everything from arguments for the existence of God, to tactics one can use when discussing the faith, to how one can use evidence to come to conclusions, and much more!

In this first episode, we want to cover the basics about what apologetics is. Given that my channel is almost entirely dedicated to apologetics, this has frankly been a long time coming. So if you want to know what apologetics is, what faith is, and how apologetics can be used, then this is the video for you. 

Like with all my videos, below are several timestamps to help you navigate the video:

Hope you all enjoy this video, and with any luck this will end up being an ongoing, regularly updated series on this channel.

title: The WORST VIDEO I've made in a while
description: Big things coming. Trust me.

title: DID GOD SIGN HIS NAME ON OUR DNA?!?!
description:
Hey everyone, hope y'all are enjoying this Maundy Thursday. In this video I will be assessing the claim that God has literally signed his name onto our DNA via a repeating pattern of disulfide bridges in the DNA. 
In addition to this, I will also provide all of you with an in-depth look at the structure of DNA and RNA, so that by the time you're done this video, you will be able to better understand the molecules that help encode who you are. 

Below are timestamps to navigate through the different topics discussed in this video:

0:00 Intro/philosophy
4:59 DNA is a polymer
7:12 Nucleotides and nitrogenous bases
13:23 The sugars of DNA and RNA
15:44 Phosphates and phosphodiester bonds
19:36 DNA is complementary and antiparallel 
25:17 Hydrogen bonds (H bonds)
36:36 Summary of DNA's structure
40:41 Did God sign our DNA?
46:08 Hershey & Chase's experiment
57:00 DNA is right handed?
1:02:46 Where did this claim come from?
1:07:15 The 3 domains of life
1:09:26 The unfortunate truth
1:12:58 So is God not real then?

As I mentioned at the start and end of this video, if you want to see two videos I've done which look at some of the evidence/arguments for God's existence, those videos can be found below:
https://youtu.be/0hn-7ckOt-8
https://youtu.be/RD6aDpBfXpo

Below is the link to the channel Beau Maths. As I warned in this video, do not under any circumstances check out his channel, as I don't think extended periods of exposure to that nerd is healthy for anyone:
https://www.youtube.com/@beaumaths

Additionally, if you wish to see the original video of Dr. Rubenstein claiming to have found God's signature on our DNA you can check that out below:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ArR_UseV7Xk

If you want to watch that video I made with Beau Maths on biblically accurate angels you can see that below as well:
https://youtu.be/PwX9gsRavQY


This video was unfortunately a fairly long time coming. I was hoping to get this video out by Saint Patrick's day, but the software I used to edit videos actually refused to export the video. So, I basically had to remake the video from scratch with a new editing software, hence why it's coming out today. Sorry for that delay, but I hope you enjoy this video nonetheless. Once again, have a blessed Maundy Thursday, and I hope y'all have a wonderful Good Friday and Easter as well. Remember, Christ died for your sins. His body was broken and His blood was poured out for you. But most importantly, He is risen!









#christian #christianity #science #biology

title: Jesus the God-Man | Part 6: Answering Objections (ft. The Church Fathers)
description:
Hey everyone, I hope you're enjoying this leap-year. I thought it would be fun to upload this video today since it only comes around once every 4 years. Today is also a very exciting day because today is the day I'm uploading the 6th and final episode in my series on the deity of Jesus. Unlike the last 5 parts of this series in which the focus was looking at how the New Testament shows that Jesus is divine, this episode will focus primarily on answering objections that people give to the deity of Jesus. Additionally, we will also look at some of the earliest Christians from between 100-325 CE (sometimes called the early church fathers or ante-Nicene fathers) and see how their writings indicate that from the beginning, Christians have believed that Jesus was God.

If you haven't seen the last 5 videos in this series, I'd highly encourage you to check them out. The links to those parts can be found below:

https://youtu.be/jfHFydpznwo

https://www.str.org/w/nine-early-church-fathers-who-taught-jesus-is-god

https://www.youtube.com/live/Gq1uYD8CzJ8
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O_2iYSyus5I

If you wanna see a video that goes into more detail on the concept of "the Firstborn" in the ancient near east, I'd highly recommend the video linked below:

If you wanted to see the sermon I did in which I give an analogy for the trinity, the link to that is below:
https://youtu.be/sUF5OGw9j-4?

If you wanted to see the video done by "Red Pen logic" where he discusses how Jesus could be God even if he didn't know something, the link to that is found below as well:

Lastly but certainly not least, if you want to watch the video answering what Jesus meant when he said "I can do nothing on my own", the link to that is found below:
https://youtu.be/LH3eDQgzhIE?

Like in the last 5 videos in this series, there are timestamps below that should help you navigate through the video and the topics discussed therein:

I sincerely hope you enjoy this video. I cannot express my gratitude that so many people have benefitted from this series, and I hope that those of you watching will benefit from this last episode in the series. I wish all of you a great day, and a happy leap year. God bless all of y'all.

title: Jesus the God-Man | Part 1: What Makes a God?
description:
Hey everyone, I hope you enjoy this first video in a series where I attempt to chronicle every reference to the deity of Jesus in the New Testament. Think of this as the closest thing you'll get to a Christmas special this year... I mean it kinda works, this video talks about the deity of Jesus, which is definitely a core element of the incarnation which we celebrate at Christmas. The video even mentions the council of Nicaea, the same council where jolly old Saint Nick himself slapped Arius for blaspheming Jesus... so ya, this is your Christmas special for the year. 

As you might expect, there were quite a number of sections in the Bible that talk about Jesus' divinity, so this will be a relatively lengthy multi-part series. This unfortunately means that this may end up being the last video I make in 2023, but there will definitely be more to come, and in particular more videos in this series come 2024. 

With all that being said, I hope you enjoy this video, and I hope it helps you get a better idea as to why Christians believe that Jesus is God. As seen below there are timestamps to navigate the video and the topics discussed therein:

0:00 The Trinity and Nicaea
3:40 The First and the Last
6:30 Jesus was Worshipped
12:55 What's in a Name?
19:02 Jesus' Power Over Nature
20:12 Jesus Forgives People's Sins
26:02 Jesus, the Judge and Resurrection
32:00 Who Sends God's Spirit?
35:05 Jesus, Lord of the Sabbath
36:17 God Shares His Glory with None... but Jesus
38:14 Jesus' Unique Connection with God
39:05 Why did David Call Jesus Lord?
40:58 Jesus' Omnipresence 
41:56 Jesus the Mind-Reader
43:45 Outro

Merry Christmas, and remember, Christ is Lord!

title: How Biblically Accurate are Biblically Accurate Angels?
description:
Happy Halloween and happy Reformation day to all of y'all! Today we got a very different type of video than my usual for this Halloween/Reformation day special, so I hope y'all enjoy it. Me and my friend will be reviewing various depictions of angels, and - in the spirit of Reformation day -  will be going back to the bible to see whether these angel depictions are as biblically accurate as they claim to be. 

Massive shoutout to my boi @beaumaths for helping me out with this video. Please check him out as he's got plenty of great videos that provide new and intuitive ways of understanding various mathematical concepts.

If you wanted to check out the website where I got the images of seraphim seals, the link is shown below:
https://www.bibleodyssey.org/image-gallery/seraphim-seals/

Also, since this did get brought up in the video, if you wanna see a video of mine that discusses the intersection of theology and biology, I'd recommend the video I made titled "Why We Live in a Miracle", the link is shown just below:
https://youtu.be/0hn-7ckOt-8


Like with most of my videos, the timestamps for the video are shown below, and for most of these timestamps, the artist who made the art we're critiquing is credited. Please feel free to check out the artists listed below, as all the art we reviewed in this video was great regardless of its biblical accuracy. 

0:00 Intro
2:20 What do Cherubim look like? (Ezekiel 1)

title: The Missing Lamb of Genesis 22
description:
Hey guys, here's another video for you. This one is a bit different from the last few uploads I've made, at least in part cuz it's probably one of the shortest videos I'll ever make. Additionally, unlike my last few videos which have been excerpts from sermons I've done, this video is a much more heavily edited video, with the editing done by yours truly. As you can tell from my very clearly professionally made thumbnail, this video's editing is going to be leagues above anything else you've ever seen on this platform. But in all seriousness, I hope you enjoy this video and I hope this video helps you better see the strong connections between the Old Testament and New Testament.


Timestamps for the different sections of the video are shown below:
0:00 What is typology?
1:40 The binding of Isaac
3:48 Genesis 22:1-2
5:24 Did God make a mistake?
8:38 A confusing contradiction
9:30 Genesis 22:3-4
10:05 Genesis 22:5 The contradiction resolved
12:35 Genesis 22:6
13:55 Genesis 22:7-9 (I could probably take a 100 year old in a fight)
16:30 Genesis 22:10-14 Angels, rams, and missing lambs
20:02 Genesis 22:15-19 A promise fulfilled
20:46 Summary and concluding thoughts 


If you wish to watch another (much better) video looking at the meaning of Genesis 22, how it's profound message permeates through the whole bible, and how said message still impacts us today, I'd highly recommend this video below. However, I will warn you that it does involve fairly disturbing comments and content.

https://youtu.be/0kw90Eg2jEs?si=ll7jDYIluamdi3zH

title: Oh BTW, Jesus is God
description:
Hey everyone, it's been a few months since the last video. Hope you enjoy this sermon which covers a topic much more rooted in the Bible compared to the last two sermons that I've uploaded to this channel. If all goes well, you will likely find that my next upload will be quite similar to this one. 

Here are the timestamps for the various sections of the video:
0:00 Intro/Technical Difficulties
3:15 Scripture Reading
5:00 Better Understanding the Trinity
8:16 My Bad Analogy for the Trinity 
11:00 What to Expect for the Rest of the Sermon
12:00 Who is John the Baptist Preparing the Way for?
13:25 How Psalm 136 Shows Jesus is God
17:20 How Storms and Seas Show that Jesus is God
22:34 The Blood of God was Shed for Us
25:35 Jesus the Psychic? 
27:25 Jesus, the Lord of Hosts
29:00 Jesus the Rule-Breaker
31:13 Jesus the Miracle-Worker 
34:47 My Favorite Way to Show that Jesus is God 
40:43 Dealing with Objections to the Trinity 
45:30 Pay Attention and Follow Jesus
51:30 Benediction(s)

If you want some context on why bad analogies for the trinity qualify as an "age old Irish tradition", you can check that out using the link below:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KQLfgaUoQCw 

If you wish to see my previous two sermons on natural theology and on the historical evidence for the resurrection of Jesus Christ, links to those videos are available below:
https://youtu.be/0hn-7ckOt-8
https://youtu.be/RD6aDpBfXpo

title: Oh BTW, Jesus really rose from the dead
description:
He is Risen!
Happy Easter/Pascha everybody! I hope you are all enjoying yourselves as we celebrate the resurrection of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.
Since itâs that time of the year again, I thought that it would be appropriate to reupload a sermon I did on this very topic.
In this video I hope to show that the resurrection is a historical fact, one that can by proven using several other historical facts that are agreed upon by most (well over 70%) of all historians and new testament scholars (including atheist/skeptical/agnostic scholars). 
By using the following known historical facts in this video I hope to show that HEâS RISEN:

Horrid Death by Crucifixion
Empty Tomb
âSisters in Christâ Discovered the Empty Tomb

Rough Treatment of the Apostles
Independent Appearances of Christ to His Apostles
Skeptics Converted After Jesusâ Death
Expectations were Defied by the Resurrection
Nearby and Early Preaching in Jerusalem 


It should be noted that the details used to prove the resurrection here come from historical facts that virtually everyone in the relevant fields agree upon. This means that anything that is disputed by historians or biblical scholars which could still serve as evidence for the resurrection (such as the Shroud of Turin and numerous passages in the Bible) are not included here as evidence, even if many would agree that they help substantiate the claim that the resurrection actually took place. For this reason the argument presented here is often referred to as the "Minimal Facts" argument for the resurrection, as it only uses data that everyone agrees upon, rather than using all data that would support the claim for the resurrection being a historical event.


Timestamps for the video:
0:00 Intro
0:15 Scripture Reading
1:55 What is at Stake
3:25 Evidence for the Resurrection (HE'S RISEN)
5:40 Jesus Was Crucified 
6:15 Jesus Was Buried in a Tomb
9:45 Jesus' Tomb was Empty 
12:55 Women Discovered the Empty Tomb 
14:20 Jesus' Followers Claimed to see the Living Jesus
15:45 Skeptics Converted by the Risen Christ
17:40 The Apostles Preached in Jerusalem 
20:00 Jesus' Resurrection Defied Everyone's Expectations
23:20 The Persecution and Martyrdom of the Apostles
27:00 Alternative Theories to the Resurrection
27:20 What if Jesus was just Unconscious?
29:25 What if all of this was Made Up Decades Later?
31:20 What if the Apostles Lied About the Resurrection?
34:40 Couldn't Mass Hallucinations Explain the Resurrection?
38:30 Impostor? Among us?!? Funny???
40:35 Did the Women go to the Wrong Tomb?
42:15 Why the Evidence Points to the Resurrection
47:20 Closing Prayer
48:05 Benediction and Illiteracy


If you liked this video and want to see more discussions on this subject, I'd highly recommend some of the videos and channels featured below, as they elaborate on many of the topics I discussed here in more detail, they may present evidence I neglected to show here, or they may cite other scholarly sources for further digging into this subject. These videos provided me with much of the inspiration to make this sermon, so I cannot recommend them enough.


Other videos to check out on this subject:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ay_Db4RwZ_M
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5znVUFHqO4Q
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wICHji-kh-s
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BltIwge0LiA
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M6_pZV9zXzQ
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C8BU_R7QoYo
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z8lkuuhVkOI
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G8nksgZerZE

A Playlist on this Subject:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-ErnJF_nwBk&list=PL1mr9ZTZb3TUYymBPce08oyuhnHLLkR_B

And once again, happy Easter, He is Risen! Hallelujah!

title: Why We Live in a Miracle
description:
Hope y'all enjoy this video where I consistently forget that bringing the microphone closer to one's face causes one to get louder. 

As mentioned in the video here are the timestamps for all the different concepts discussed:
0:00 Intro
1:10 Children's moment
6:55 Scripture for Sermon

13:20 The Cosmological Argument
23:13 The Teleological/Fine Tuning Argument
36:02 How DNA Demonstrates Design
45:23 How Proteins Prove a Programmer
52:22 Summary/Limits of Natural Theology
56:50 Prayer
57:25 Outro 

Additionally, as I noted in this video, I have provided a few links to several other videos discussing the same topics covered here, along with dealing with some common objections to the arguments I discussed. title: We're Back Bros
description:
Sorry for the nearly 4 year hiatus, it probably will happen again.

I'm hoping to start uploading some stuff by late April/early May, but if I am lucky I should be able to upload at least two things earlier than that. 




















Also yes I am unironically converting this channel into a theology channel.
Also no, I am not changing the name of the channel into something more appropriate for that purpose.

title: How to Meme
description: Just a quick tutorial on how to make a meme. This is also a brief explanation of how I and a few others made the meme I uploaded a few days ago.

description: Hey gang, thanks for waiting for about... probably around 6 or so months, just to see this. Wow, I could really use a regular upload schedule, regardless hope y'all enjoy.
